briefdescription.para: A group of clustered points (ie features within the distance tolerance).
Groups of features that are considered clustered together.
Whether labels should be drawn for points. This is set internally from startRender() depending on scale denominator.
Mapping of feature ID to the feature's group index.
Mapping of feature ID to approximate group location.
Attribute name for labeling. An empty string indicates that no labels should be rendered.
Label text color.
Label font.
Label attribute index (or -1 if none). This index is not stored, it is requested in the startRender() method.
Maximum scale denominator for label display. A zero value indicates no scale limitation.
Embedded base renderer. This can be used for rendering individual, isolated points.
Spatial index for fast lookup of nearby points.
Distance tolerance. Points that are closer together than this distance are considered clustered.
Map unit scale for distance tolerance.
Unit for distance tolerance.
Constructor for QgsPointDistanceRenderer.
Returns details about internals of this renderer.

detaileddescription.para: E.g. if you only want to deal with visible features:

briefdescription.para: item in symbology was checked
Returns the current embedded renderer (subrenderer) for this feature renderer.

detaileddescription.para:
The base class implementation does not use subrenderers and will always return null.
setEmbeddedRenderer()
QGIS 2.16

briefdescription.para: If a renderer does not require all the features this method may be overridden and return an expression used as where clause.

detaileddescription.para: This will be called once after startRender() and before the first call to renderFeature(). By default this returns a null string and all features will be requested. You do not need to specify the extent in here, this is taken care of separately and will be combined with a filter returned from this method.

simplesect.para: An expression used as where clause

briefdescription.para: Returns true if this renderer requires the geometry to apply the filter.
Returns the attribute name used for labeling points, or an empty string if no labeling will be done by the renderer.
Returns the color used for for labeling points.
Returns the font used for labeling points.
Returns legend keys matching a specified feature.
items of symbology items in legend is checked
Returns a list of symbology items for the legend.
items of symbology items in legend should be checkable
Returns the minimum map scale (i.e.

detaileddescription.para:
most "zoomed out") at which points should be labeled by the renderer. The scale value indicates the scale denominator, e.g. 1000.0 for a 1:1000 map.
setMinimumLabelScale()
labelAttributeName()

briefdescription.para: Returns symbol for feature.

detaileddescription.para:
The difference compared to symbolForFeature() is that it returns original symbol which can be used as an identifier for renderer's rule - the former may return a temporary replacement of a symbol for use in rendering.
QGIS 2.12

briefdescription.para: Equivalent of originalSymbolsForFeature() call extended to support renderers that may use more symbols per feature - similar to symbolsForFeature()

memberdef.argsstring: (const QgsFeature &feature, QgsRenderContext &context, int layer=-1, bool selected=false, bool drawVertexMarker=false) override
memberdef.name: renderFeature

briefdescription.para: Render a feature using this renderer in the given context.

detaileddescription.para: Must be called between startRender() and stopRender() calls. Default implementation renders a symbol as determined by symbolForFeature() call. Returns true if the feature has been returned (this is used for example to determine whether the feature may be labelled).
If layer is not -1, the renderer should draw only a particula layer from symbols (in order to support symbol level rendering).

briefdescription.para: Sets an embedded renderer (subrenderer) for this feature renderer.

detaileddescription.para:
The base class implementation does nothing with subrenderers, but individual derived classes can use these to modify their behavior.
subRenderer
the embedded renderer. Ownership will be transferred.
embeddedRenderer()
QGIS 2.16

briefdescription.para: Sets the attribute name for labeling points.

parameterdescription.para: attribute name, or empty string to avoid labeling features by the renderer

briefdescription.para: Sets the color to use for for labeling points.
Sets the font used for labeling points.
Sets the symbol to be used for a legend symbol item.

parameterdescription.para: new symbol for legend item. Ownership is transferred to renderer.

briefdescription.para: Sets the minimum map scale (i.e.

detaileddescription.para:
most "zoomed out") at which points should be labeled by the renderer. The scale value indicates the scale denominator, e.g. 1000.0 for a 1:1000 map.

setLabelAttributeName()

briefdescription.para: Sets the tolerance distance for grouping points.

Units are specified using setToleranceUnit().
distance

scale

briefdescription.para: Sets the units for the tolerance distance.
Must be called when a new render cycle is started.

detaileddescription.para: A call to startRender() must always be followed by a corresponding call to stopRender() after all features have been rendered.

parameterdescription.para: Additional information passed to the renderer about the job which will be rendered

simplesect.para: This method is not thread safe. Before calling startRender() in a non-main thread, the renderer should instead be cloned and startRender()/stopRender() called on the clone.

briefdescription.para: Must be called when a render cycle has finished, to allow the renderer to clean up.

detaileddescription.para: Calls to stopRender() must always be preceded by a call to startRender().

simplesect.para: This method is not thread safe. Before calling startRender() in a non-main thread, the renderer should instead be cloned and startRender()/stopRender() called on the clone.

briefdescription.para: To be overridden.

detaileddescription.para:
Must be called between startRender() and stopRender() calls.
feature
feature
context
render context
returns pointer to symbol or 0 if symbol was not found

briefdescription.para: Returns list of symbols used by the renderer.
Returns list of symbols used for rendering the feature.

For renderers that do not support MoreSymbolsPerFeature it is more efficient to use symbolForFeature()

Returns a list of attributes required by this renderer.

detaileddescription.para: Attributes not listed in here may not have been requested from the provider at rendering time.

briefdescription.para: Returns whether the renderer will render a feature or not.

detaileddescription.para:
Must be called between startRender() and stopRender() calls. Default implementation uses symbolForFeature().

briefdescription.para: Renders the labels for a group.

parameterdescription.para: group of clustered features to label

simplesect.para: may not be available in Python bindings on some platforms

briefdescription.para: Creates an expression context scope for a clustered group, with variables reflecting the group's properties.
Draws a group of clustered points.

parameterdescription.para: central point (geographic centroid) of all points contained within the cluster

briefdescription.para: Internal group rendering helper.
Returns first symbol from the embedded renderer for a feature or nullptr if none.
Returns the label text for a feature (using mLabelAttributeName as attribute field)
Debugging function to check the entries in the clustered groups.
Creates a search rectangle with specified distance tolerance.
An abstract base class for distance based point renderers (e.g., clusterer and displacement renderers).

detaileddescription.para:
QgsPointDistanceRenderer handles calculation of point clusters using a distance based threshold. Subclasses must implement drawGroup() to handle the rendering of individual point clusters in the desired style.
QGIS 3.0
